p: For this literature, see, for example, Bou-Habib, op. cit.; Bou-Habib and Olsaretti, op. cit.; Caney “Human Rights, Population, and Climate Change,” op. cit.; Elizabeth Cripps, “Climate Change, Population, and Justice: Hard Choices to Avoid Tragic Choices,” Global Justice: Theory Practice Rethoric, Vol. 8, No. 2 (2015), pp. 1-22; Elizabeth Cripps, “Population and Environment: The Impossible, the Impermissible and the Imperative,” in Stephen Gardiner and Allen Thompson eds., Oxford Handbook of Environmental Ethics (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2016), pp. 380-390; MacIver, op. cit.; Travis Rieder, Toward a Small Family Ethic: How Overpopulation and Climate Change are Affecting the Morality of Procreation (New York: Springer, 2016); Vallentyne op. cit.
